byline.contributor: Thomas Erdbrink contributed reporting from Tehran.
byline.original: By DAVID E. SANGER and MICHAEL R. GORDON

abstract: Iran nuclear agreement talks in Vienna stall over key point, concerning whether International Atomic Energy Agency can conduct investigations without restrictions of any nuclear-related experimentation by Iranians; impasse worries some legislative members who plan to veto any version of deal that excludes it and increases pressure on negotiators struggling to find compromise.
lead_paragraph: Negotiators differ on whether to force Iran to reveal any suspected work on nuclear weapons, and to grant unfettered access to more sites.

headline.main: Iran Nuclear Talks Could Stall Over Access to Scientists and Sites
headline.print_headline: Feud Over Access to Scientists and Sites Could Stall Iran Nuclear Talks

snippet: Negotiators differ on whether to force Iran to reveal any suspected work on nuclear weapons, and to grant unfettered access to more sites.
